definition[0]: a long stick or post usually made of wood or metal, often set upright in the ground to support something
definition[1]: the most northern or most southern point on a planet, especially the Earth
example[1]: the distance from pole to equator
example[2]: Amundsenâ€™s expedition was the first to reach the South Pole.
definition[2]: one of two situations, ideas, or opinions that are the complete opposite of each other
example[3]: We have enormous wealth at one pole, and poverty and misery at the other.
example[4]: Washington and Beijing are at opposite poles  (=think in two completely different ways) on this issue.
definition[3]: one of two points at the ends of a magnet where its power is the strongest
definition[4]: one of the two points at which wires can be attached to a battery in order to use its electricity
definition[5]: to push a boat along in the water using a pole
